goals.question: What is the distribution of temperature in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of temperature values in the dataset and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: How does the humidity vary with respect to time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of humidity over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any trends or patterns in the humidity levels over time and understand how they vary with respect to different time periods.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wind speed vs temperature
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation or patterns between wind speed and temperature and understand how they affect each other.

goals.question: What is the distribution of pressure in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of pressure values in the dataset and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: How does the weather condition vary with respect to time?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of weather condition over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any trends or patterns in the weather conditions over time and understand how they vary with respect to different time periods.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Temperature'] = pd.to_numeric(data['Temperature'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Temperature'])]
    
    plt.hist(data['Temperature'], bins=30, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='Temperature')
    plt.axvline(data['Temperature'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['Temperature'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Temperature')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of temperature in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]
    
    plt.plot(data['date'], data['humidity'], label='Humidity', color='blue')
    plt.xlabel('Time')
    plt.ylabel('Humidity')
    plt.title('How does the humidity vary with respect to time?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['wind_speed'], data['temperature'])
    plt.xlabel('Wind Speed')
    plt.ylabel('Temperature')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['pressure'].plot(kind='hist', bins=20, alpha=0.75, color='blue', edgecolor='black')
    plt.axvline(data['pressure'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['pressure'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Pressure')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of pressure in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]
    
    weather_conditions = data['weather_condition'].unique()
    colors = plt.cm.get_cmap('tab10', len(weather_conditions))
    
    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
    for i, condition in enumerate(weather_conditions):
        condition_data = data[data['weather_condition'] == condition]
        plt.bar(condition_data['date'], condition_data['weather_condition'], color=colors(i), label=condition)
    
    plt.xlabel('Date')
    plt.ylabel('Weather Condition')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('How does the weather condition vary with respect to time?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(title='Weather Conditions', loc='upper left')
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
